paper_abstract: SMART (SINGLE-CYCLE MULTIHOP ASYNCHRONOUS REPEATED TRAVERSAL) AIMS TO DYNAMICALLY SET UP SINGLE-CYCLE PATHS (WITH TURNS) FROM THE SOURCE TO THE DESTINATION FOR MESSAGE FLOWS SHARING A NETWORK ON CHIP. A FLOW-CONTROL TECHNIQUE ARBITRATES FOR AND RESERVES MULTIPLE LINKS WITHIN A CYCLE. A ROUTER AND LINK MICROARCHITECTURE ENABLES A MULTIHOP (9 TO 11 HOPS AT 1 GHZ IN 45 NM) TRAVERSAL WITHIN A CYCLE.
paper_title: SMART: SINGLE-CYCLE MULTIHOP TRAVERSALS OVER A SHARED NETWORK ON CHIP
